member.summary: Create a new set of failures that activate on a given condition.

member.summary: Resets and remove this ArmedFailure.
member.remarks: After this call, the ArmedFailure object is invalid and should nolonger be used.

summary.para: This class contains a non normal situation or event in the simulator.

member.summary: The name of the failure.

member.summary: The domain of the value.
member.remarks: Domains can be used for grouping. They are strings like "Electric", "Pneumatic", "Hydraulic", etc.

member.name: P:ProSimSDK.Failure.groupName
member.summary: When the failure is part of a group, this provides the group name.
member.example: For "Engine number 1 failure", the groupName would be "Engine failure" and the groupMember would be "Engine 1".

member.name: P:ProSimSDK.Failure.groupMember
member.summary: When the failure is part of a group, this provides the group member.
member.example: For "Engine number 1 failure", the groupName would be "Engine failure" and the groupMember would be "Engine 1".

member.summary: The classification of the failure.

member.name: E:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.onConnect
member.summary: Event raised when a connection is established to ProSim737.
member.remarks: The event may be fired from a non GUI thread.

member.name: E:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.onDisconnect
member.summary: Event raised when a connection is lost.
member.remarks: The event may be fired from a non GUI thread.

member.name: E:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.onFailedToConnect
member.summary: Event raised when a connection attempt has failed (only in case of non-synchronous connects). It will continue to try to connect.
member.remarks: The event may be fired from a non GUI thread.

member.name: E:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.onDataRefsUpdated
member.summary: Event raised after each variable update batch is completed
member.remarks: The event may be fired from a non GUI thread.

member.name: E:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.onFailedToConnectStatus
member.summary: Event raised after each variable update batch is completed
member.remarks: The event may be fired from a non GUI thread.

member.name: E:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.onWeatherReceived
member.summary: Event raised after a requested weather has been received
member.remarks: The event may be fired from a non GUI thread.

member.name: E:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.onAiTrafficAdded
member.summary: Event raised after an AI traffic object has been added
member.remarks: The event may be fired from a non GUI thread.

member.name: E:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.onAiTrafficRemoved
member.summary: Event raised after an AI traffic object has been removed
member.remarks: The event may be fired from a non GUI thread.

member.name: E:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.OnMainDatabaseBuilt
member.summary: Event raised after a push for main database was call.
member.remarks: The event may be fired from a non GUI thread.

member.name: E:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.OnDatabaseBuilderActionChanged
member.summary: Event raised after a changes on the database builder.
member.remarks: The event may be fired from a non GUI thread.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.#ctor
member.summary: Intantiates a new ProSimConnect object.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.Connect
member.summary: Connect to ProSim737 on the local machine.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.Connect(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts a connection to ProSim737 over the network.
member.param: The host name or IP address of the machine to connect to.

remarks.para: By default, or when synchronous is True, the Connect method will try to establish a connection immediatly. When the connection fails, an exception will be thrown.

When synchrousnous is is False, the method will return immediately and connection attempts will start. In this case, the connection will not be ready after the call, and the isConnected property or onConnect events should be used to check the status of the connection.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.Dispose
member.summary: Disconnects and disposes of this connection.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.Register(ProSimSDK.DataRef)
member.summary: Registers a DataRef to this connection.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.unRegister(ProSimSDK.DataRef)
member.summary: Unregisters a DataRef from this connection.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.ReadDataRef(System.String)
member.summary: Read a single DataRef.
member.exception: This ProSimConnect instance is not connected.
The DataRef was not recognized by ProSim737.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.getDataRefDescriptions
member.summary: Retrieves a list of all currently supported DataRef.
member.returns: A list of all currently supported DataRefs.
member.exception: The ProSimConnect instance is not connected.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.getFailures
member.summary: Gets a list of supported failures from the connected ProSim737 System.
member.exception: The ProSimConnect instance is not connected.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.setSDKPriorityMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets this clients priority mode
member.remarks: When the SDK Priority mode is enabled, the client application can override switches and analog axes.
member.exception: The ProSimConnect instance is not connected.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.getArmedFailures
member.summary: Gets a list of all ArmedFailures currently in the system.

remarks.para: The returned list only represents the ArmedFailures that were active at the time of the call. To get an up to date view of Armed Failures, refer to ArmedFailure.onNew and ArmedFailure.onRemove.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.getLicensingInfo
member.summary: Get licensing mode and available features.
member.returns: Null in case of an error

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.createTCASConflict(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a TCAS conflict aircraft that will create a TCAS conflict somewhere in the future.
member.param: Distance in nautical miles between the current position and the conflict.
Distance in feet between the aircraft and the TCAS conflict aircraft. Positive values cause the TCAS conflict aircraft to be above the simulator aircraft.
Conflict bearing. Use 0 for head on.
member.remarks: The actual availability of the TCAS conflict option depends on the license type of ProSim737 System.
member.returns: True if creation of TCAS conflict was successful. False if ProSim737 instance does not support TCAS aircraft.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.createWindshear(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Place a windshear in the flightpath that will cause a windshear GPWS warning.
member.param: The altitude at which the windshear will occur.
If True, the windshear will be detected at least 2.5NM out. If False, the windshear will be detected 1NM out.
member.remarks: The actual availability of TCAS conflict option depends on the license type of ProSim737 System.
member.returns: True if creation if creation of the windshear was successful. False if ProSim737 instance does not support windshear creation.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.windshearArmed
member.summary: Return true if a windshear condition is armed.
member.returns: True if a windshear condition is armed.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.clearWindshear
member.summary: Clear an armed windshear condition.

member.name: M:ProSimSDK.ProSimConnect.setUnusualAttitude(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set pitch and roll to a specific value to cause an unusual attitude.
member.param: The pitch value to set. Positive values are used for pitch up.
The roll value to set. Positive values are right wing down.
member.returns: True if the attitude was set successfully. False if ProSim737 instance does not support setting unusual attitudes.
